page.title: 10WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
page.content: The Women's Institute is a non-political, non-sectarian organisation.It is also a registered charity. The fortyfive members of the Colsterworth branch meet monthly and are concerned about local, national and international issues. Discussions have been held on a variety of subjects during 1985, including drug abuse, world food shortage and it's possible alleviation, and acid rain damage to forests and buildings.Speakers are invited to talk and demonstate their skills in culinary and artistic crafts as well as informative and educational subjects. on a lighter side, the members present a christmas concert annually. Funds are raised and used for the community's benefit , including seats installed at the old peoples housing complex, trees planted
